column1: The term supersonic is used to describe a speed that is over the speed of sound (Mach 1). At a normal temperature like 70 degrees Fahrenheit (21.1 °C)
column2: the speed needed for something to be traveling at a faster than sound speed is about 344 m/s
column6: 238 km/h. Speeds faster than 5 times the speed of sound are sometimes called hypersonic. Speeds where only some parts of the air around an object (like the propeller) reach supersonic speeds are called transonic (normally somewhere between Mach 0.8 and Mach 1.2).It can be very hard to reach supersonic speeds
column7: because drag increases a lot near these speeds. This slows a plane
column8: and for years made control difficult. These problems were called the "sound barrier". Jet engines and other developments solved the problems in the middle 20th century.
